page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This block is predominantly a farming area, each farm having the usual farm- house and buildings. There are a few small areas of woodland, which are not used commercially, and one large area of conifers, planted for later commercia use, by the Forestry Commission. There is one village with its church and chapel, shop and garage. The whole area has a maze of lanes, but only one through "B" road which carries transport. The area is widely used as "dormitory" accommodation and people travel into their work as there is no local industry (farming is the only local type of work). It is a truly rural area in every sense.
